timeline.bodyText: I think nextFormNumber.substring(4, 5) should be   nextFormNumber.substring(4) instead. Consider a form with two digit steps e.g. step10 for example.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Also, do we need this complex logic to extract the current step? Wasn't this working? https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/pull/407/files#diff-4af3b3a5f5179b96a2f8051da8ad980ec341e72fc18aa4bd23f0cbc2c2216845L738?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: I don't think there's a constraint on NF that guarantees a step's next value has to be +1 of it's current value. In RDT, we have steps that don't even have a next value.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: Can this be simplified to formNumber = currentFormNumber > 0 ? currentFormNumber : 1 since a step is not expected to ever be negative?
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: @bennsimon any idea why the skip blank step logic still doesn't work for JsonFormFragments? Seems related to this code being removed and moved to JsonWizardFormFragmentPresenter https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/pull/407/files#diff-026e337bf5459fc5eee13061b659364e67ba948390ac996edef6fb3feae6ca3dR53.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Blank steps are not being skipped on both back and next press on the JsonFormFragment.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: check this out https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/blob/b6bdad0041abc719e125725fd53efb4325705d99/android-json-form-wizard/src/main/java/com/vijay/jsonwizard/presenters/JsonWizardFormFragmentPresenter.java#L43 ...
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Ok, can we move this call back to onResume? https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/blob/b6bdad0041abc719e125725fd53efb4325705d99/android-json-form-wizard/src/main/java/com/vijay/jsonwizard/presenters/JsonWizardFormFragmentPresenter.java#L53
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: and would that solve the backpress issues as well?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText:
JsonFormFragmentPresenter has onNextClick you can copy the changes from JsonWizardFormFragmentPresenter ...
Ok, can we move this call back to onResume?
No dont move this
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Check this too https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/blob/abe02b5e496ed17dbfbb48cb569bd257b12480c0/android-json-form-wizard/src/main/java/com/vijay/jsonwizard/presenters/JsonFormFragmentPresenter.java#L286
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Moving to JsonFormFragmentPresenter doesn't seem to work. Could you take a look? #512
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText:
This validation logic may not be necessary after this merges #476.
This count can be retrieved from the count object.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: It is since #476 does not ensure the repeating group is actually created ... it only checks for text change
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: It can be modified to only write into the count object after repeating group generation. And that can be used to verify the generation was done.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: will update this
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: This update can be tracked here #504
replies.author: bennsimon

timeline.bodyText: Any reason for changing the method signature? This is a public method which could be called elsewhere.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: The step field is useful for it to be used elsewhere, on top of that that the step field is needed to ensure that only the fields that have that step prefix (address) will be converted during dynamic rules creating process
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Is this a bug fix? If not, a method can be added that has the same signature with the added step parameter and retain the original method which will now call the new method with a null step value. Then perform the new operations only if step is not null.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: yeah it is
replies.author: bennsimon

timeline.bodyText: Not clear what this does, please add a comment or move to a descriptive method.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri
vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: Is this skip logic only relevant to wizard forms? Could it also be useful in other forms and in that case better placed in the JsonFormFragment?
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: i mean skip logic is only relevant if there is more than one step .... Why would single step forms need a skip logic?
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText:
JsonFormFragment is not solely for single step forms.
JsonFormFragment is the parent to JsonWizardFormFragment so why not have the code there for apps that extend either fragment?
We are currently using this functionality so this would be a breaking change and it's not clear that it's necessary to make this migration.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: I think that when two classes share a feature is when the super class should have some 'initializing' code with some customization on the child. In this case skipping step is only a feature for JsonWizardFormFragment hence i dont see the need for this. I would suggest you use JsonWizardFormFragment in your implementation since its a child class and will have all that JsonFormFragment has.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure I understand this. Why is skipping a step only unique to (or needed in) the JsonWizardFormFragment and not in the JsonFormFragment? Isn't this feature useful for all kinds of forms and not just wizard forms?
It's not ideal to switch to JsonWizardFormFragment since we (and perhaps other implementations):

Don't need the extra features it provides
Have custom a JsonFormFragment that has overridden behaviour from the parent class.
Related to 2, have made some assumptions when working with JsonFormFragment which may be broken when migrating to JsonWizardFormFragment.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText:
Question.
How are you using the skipping step feature in a JsonFormFragment in your implementation? It cant be to skip step since you only have one step .... Am curious.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: I think there's some confusion around how JsonFormFragment works. JsonFormFragment does support multi-step forms. We have multiple multi-step forms in our implementation, one of which benefits from skipping blanks steps.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: To be clear you use JsonFormFragment in the above form??? if not could i see how you currently use skipping step feature in JsonFormFragment in your implementation.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: I use JsonFormFragment for all forms. And this form has skip feature enabled.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText:
I think you should change that ... i.e you should use JsonFormFragment for single step forms and JsonWizardFormFragment for multi-step forms.
By the way skipping step feature was in JsonWizardFormFragment before you added it to JsonFormFragment
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText:
Is there a reason to use JsonFormFragment for single step forms only? I don't believe that's a requirement atm.
I moved it to JsonFormFragment because, again, it's useful for all types of forms, not just JsonWizardFormFragment forms. If another implementation wanted to extend JsonFormFragment, it could still benefit from the feature.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Please also address why I should not be concerned about the three points I raised #407 (comment).
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: @dubdabasoduba can also way in but the skipping of steps is only used on JsonWizardFormFragment for ANC forms. It would be ideal if the logic is moved to JsonWizardFormFragment since one can only skip steps in a wizard.
replies.author: githengi

replies.bodyText: @githengi I'm not sure I follow, why can steps only be skipped on wizards?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: The implementation and logic changed  .... has it broken you code?
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: #407 (comment)
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Could you consider using JsonWizardFormFragment?
replies.author: bennsimon

timeline.bodyText: What is this doing? Please add a comment.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: It prevents a very rare edge case whereby same fragment gets added twice in the fragment stack
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Please add this as a comment, it wouldn't be obvious unless you explained it to someone.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: ok
replies.author: bennsimon

timeline.bodyText: This is a public method. Changing method signature is a possible breaking change.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: This is a major version and changes will likely occur. This has been added to only filter on current step so that forms with multiple steps all the steps are not evaluated when a step is being loaded
replies.author: githengi

timeline.bodyText:
This is a public method. Changing method signature is a possible breaking change.
Is this a major version change? If so, please ignore all such comments.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri
vincent-karuri
vincent-karuri
vincent-karuri
vincent-karuri
